enriched.full_text:
Stay yet; hear reason. Edmund, I arrest thee
On capital treason; and, in thine attaint,
This gilded serpent
For your claim, fair sister,
I bar it in the interest of my wife:
'Tis she is sub-contracted to this lord,
And I, her husband, contradict your bans.
If you will marry, make your loves to me,
My lady is bespoke.
enriched.character_situation: Albany formally arrests Edmund for treason and blocks Goneril's claim to marry him. He asserts his authority as Goneril's husband while exposing the corrupt alliances threatening legitimate order.

enriched.quote: [Reads]  'If any man of quality or degree within / the lists of the army will maintain upon Edmund, / supposed Earl of Gloucester, that he is a manifold / traitor, let him appear by the third sound of the
enriched.full_text:
[Reads]  'If any man of quality or degree within
the lists of the army will maintain upon Edmund,
supposed Earl of Gloucester, that he is a manifold
traitor, let him appear by the third sound of the
trumpet: he is bold in his defence.'
enriched.character_situation: The Herald formally proclaims the trial by combat, calling for any noble to challenge Edmund's honor. This represents the formal process of justice through medieval trial by combat.

enriched.quote: Draw thy sword, / That, if my speech offend a noble heart, / Thy arm may do thee justice: here is mine. / Behold, it is the privilege of mine honours,
enriched.full_text:
Draw thy sword,
That, if my speech offend a noble heart,
Thy arm may do thee justice: here is mine.
Behold, it is the privilege of mine honours,
My oath, and my profession: I protest,
Maugre thy strength, youth, place, and eminence,
Despite thy victor sword and fire-new fortune,
Thy valour and thy heart, thou art a traitor;
False to thy gods, thy brother, and thy father;
Conspirant 'gainst this high-illustrious prince;
And, from the extremest upward of thy head
To the descent and dust below thy foot,
A most toad-spotted traitor. Say thou 'No,'
This sword, this arm, and my best spirits, are bent
To prove upon thy heart, whereto I speak,
Thou liest.
enriched.character_situation: Edgar emerges to challenge Edmund in trial by combat, formally accusing his brother of comprehensive treachery. He upholds his knightly honor and oath while seeking justice for Edmund's crimes against family and kingdom.

enriched.quote: In wisdom I should ask thy name; / But, since thy outside looks so fair and warlike, / And that thy tongue some say of breeding breathes, / What safe and nicely I might well delay
enriched.character_situation: Edmund accepts Edgar's challenge despite protocol, impressed by his opponent's noble bearing. He defiantly rejects the accusations and prepares for combat, maintaining his pride even as his schemes unravel.

enriched.quote: What you have charged me with, that have I done; / And more, much more; the time will bring it out: / 'Tis past, and so am I. But what art thou / That hast this fortune on me? If thou'rt noble,
enriched.full_text:
What you have charged me with, that have I done;
And more, much more; the time will bring it out:
'Tis past, and so am I. But what art thou
That hast this fortune on me? If thou'rt noble,
I do forgive thee.
enriched.character_situation: Edmund, mortally wounded and defeated, acknowledges his crimes and offers forgiveness to his noble opponent. He faces his end with a mixture of confession and curiosity about his conqueror's identity.

enriched.quote: Let's exchange charity. / I am no less in blood than thou art, Edmund; / If more, the more thou hast wrong'd me. / My name is Edgar, and thy father's son.
enriched.full_text:
Let's exchange charity.
I am no less in blood than thou art, Edmund;
If more, the more thou hast wrong'd me.
My name is Edgar, and thy father's son.
The gods are just, and of our pleasant vices
Make instruments to plague us:
The dark and vicious place where thee he got
Cost him his eyes.
enriched.character_situation: Edgar reveals his identity to the dying Edmund and reflects on divine justice. He sees their father's punishment as cosmic retribution for his sexual transgression that produced Edmund through adultery.
